text.text_translated: "The Life of Pi" tells a very special story. It is about a teenage boy from India. His name is Pi. His ship sinks in the Pacific Ocean. He is on a small boat with a very dangerous tiger. A Canadian author named Yann Martel wrote the book. It is his third book. The book came out in 2001. It sold more than seven million copies all over the world. It also won many prizes. People can read the book in 41 languages. Martel's father worked for his country in other countries. When Martel was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

feedback.feedback: This is a flawless A2 text. The sentence structure is consistently simple and declarative. Vocabulary is strictly within the A1/A2 range. Factual accuracy is perfect. The replacement of the C1 word 'diplomat' with the A2-level explanation 'worked for his country in other countries' is an exemplary execution of the task's requirements. No corrections are needed.
